alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:15PM EST until December 21 at 4:37AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Thompsonville, Hartford... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding will become more widespread along the Connecticut River from the Massachusetts towns of Agawam and Longmeadow, through the northern Connecticut towns of Suffield and Enfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 04/02/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
